description: The PAT_ENC_DISP table contains information from the Follow-up action on the Visit Navigator tab for the ambulatory clinical system. This information specifies how and when a patient and provider should follow up with each other after an encounter. This table also contains information about the level of service (LOS) associated with the encounter.

columns.name: PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL
columns.description: A unique, internal contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of the contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.

columns.name: CONTACT_DATE
columns.description: The date of this contact in calendar format.

columns.name: PAT_ENC_CSN_ID
columns.description: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).

columns.name: DX_FOLLOWUP_C_NAME
columns.description:
This column typically stores special instructions that the lab should follow when processing this patient's lab orders. However, some organizations choose to store other information in this column.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: ORDER_INSTR_C_NAME
columns.description:
This column typically stores the method of follow-up used to communicate order results with the patient. However, some organizations choose to store other information in this column.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: LOS_DROPPED_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category number that indicates whether the Level of Service was dropped for this encounter. The category value will be equal to "pending" only while it is in the orders queue.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Yes


No


Pending

columns.name: LOS_TRIG_ERR_YN
columns.description:
Whether or not there was an LOS trigger error when dropping the charge.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Yes


No

columns.name: LOS_NEW_OR_EST_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category number that indicates whether the patient is a new (first time being seen) or established patient.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


New


Established

columns.name: LOS_HX_LEVEL_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category number for how extensively the patient's history was discussed as entered in the Level of Service calculator.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Problem Focused


Expanded Problem Focused


Detailed


Comprehensive

columns.name: LOS_EXAM_LEVEL_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category number for the extent of the exam as entered in the Level of Service calculator.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Problem Focused


Expanded Problem Focused


Detailed


Comprehensive

columns.name: LOS_MDM_LEVEL_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category number for the complexity of the medical decision-making in this encounter as entered in the Level of Service calculator.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Straightforward


Low Complexity


Moderate Complexity


High Complexity

columns.name: LOS_NO_CHG_RSN_C_NAME
columns.description:
The reason that a charge was not triggered for a level of service. This item being populated does not imply any issues with system integrity or system build; it will be set both for legitimate reasons that a charge was not triggered as well as non-legitimate reasons.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Unspecified reason


Charge Ready to Trigger flag not set


Order Instructions set to not trigger charges


Procedure not specified


Order class set to not trigger charges


Charge triggering disabled at resulting lab


Charge filtered through discrimination programming point


No charge triggering method specified


Order is canceled


Holding until close encounter


Patient not specified


Visit not specified


Invalid LCM build


Charge trigger failed to execute


Non-chargeable external result


Orders in transmittal

columns.name: LOS_SERV_PROV_ID
columns.description: Servicing Provider for Physician LOS Charge
